title: Question 14
prompt: How might algae “clean” power plant emissions?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

Plants absorb CO2 (carbon dioxide) from the air. Carbon dioxide is released into the atmosphere when animals and plants decay, when animals breathe, and when humans burn fossil fuels like coal, oil, and wood. Increased burning of fuel has caused an increase in carbon dioxide in the atmosphere, and many scientists are investigating ways to reduce the carbon dioxide released into the atmosphere through burning fuel. Some scientists are working on using algae, a plant-like organism, to clean the emissions from power plants.
feedback:
Plants naturally remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere through photosynthesis. Algae is a type of plant, so when emissions are filtered through a large amount of algae, the algae absorbs carbon dioxide through photosynthesis. Algae is plant-like; it can absorb carbon dioxide from emissions.


Plants absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere through photosynthesis. Carbon dioxide is released into the atmosphere when animals and plants decay, when animals breathe, and when humans burn fossil fuels. Human activity has caused an increase in carbon dioxide in the atmosphere, and many scientists are investigating ways to reduce the carbon dioxide released into the atmosphere through burning fuel. Some scientists are working on using algae, a plant-like organism, to clean the emissions from power plants.
